Autonomous SEO blog sprint: L&D beginner-to-advanced guide with practical checkpoints: OpenClaw SSH execution failed: Command '['ssh', '-o', 'BatchMode=yes', 'macmini', "node $HOME/openclaw/dist/entry.js agent --agent main --session-id dictation-router --message 'You are an execution worker. Execute this task directly where possible.
Return JSON ONLY with keys: status, summary, blockers, next_steps, estimated_remaining_minutes.
Optional key allowed: team_notes (array of {agent_id, note, action_hint, handoff_to}).
status must be one of: completed, blocked, failed, in_progress.
Rules:
- Do not speculate. Only report blockers you directly verified in this run.
- If uncertain but not blocked by hard evidence, use in_progress (not blocked).
- For research tasks, if one search source fails (e.g., Brave), retry with alternatives before blocking.
- Use multiple alternatives: Google, Bing, DuckDuckGo, and direct official sources.
- Do not mark blocked just because a single search engine returns poor or empty results.
- Sub-agent execution policy: SERIALIZED ONLY.
- Do not run concurrent sub-agents.
- Do not call sessions_spawn in parallel.
- If multiple analyses are needed, run them one-by-one and then synthesize.
- Specialized policy for SEO blog growth program is ACTIVE for this task.
- Mission objective: increase organic traffic to the site with high-intent, topic-relevant posts.
- Domain focus: L&D, gamification, data, LXD, AI.
- Start every run with topic discovery: shortlist 3 candidate topics, pick 1 using relevance + ranking opportunity, and reject off-focus topics.
- Execute the full lifecycle in one run: topic selection -> keyword/SERP analysis -> brief -> writing -> optimization -> publish -> measurement note.
- Execute the following agents in strict order; no parallel branches:
1. Topic Scout: Identify high-upside topics tied to L&D, gamification, data, LXD, and AI. Output: Prioritized topic slate with thesis, audience intent, and ranking opportunity.
2. Keyword and SERP Analyst: Map keyword clusters, search intent, and competitor coverage gaps. Output: Primary keyword, supporting entities, SERP gap notes, and internal-link targets.
3. Brief Architect: Convert strategy into a clear brief and outline with unique angle. Output: Approved brief with section plan, CTA, and evidence requirements.
4. Research Analyst: Gather credible source material and practical examples. Output: Source-backed notes, claims table, and references for each major section.
5. Writer: Draft publishable post aligned with site voice and audience needs. Output: Complete draft post in site format.
6. SEO Optimizer: Optimize metadata, structure, and on-page relevance signals. Output: Title/meta/slug recommendations, heading checks, schema suggestions.
7. Editor: Improve clarity, authority, and readability while preserving intent. Output: Final edited copy with quality notes and resolved issues.
8. Refresh Planner: Define update cadence to protect rankings and freshness. Output: Post-publication refresh plan with triggers and review cadence.
9. Publishing QA: Publish and verify the post is live and correctly indexed. Output: Publish proof with URL, timestamp, and pass/fail checklist.
- Between each agent handoff, take a short cooldown pause (about 2-5 minutes) before proceeding.
- Publish/verification target:
  - Site: Shreyas Korad - Writing (https://shreyaskorad.github.io/personal-website)
  - Repo hint: /Users/shreyas/Documents/New project/.tmp/personal-website-ops
  - Posts path: posts
  - Writing index: writing.html
  - Publish script: scripts/publish_post.py
  - Style rules: blog-writing-rules.md
- Team memory exchange: no historical notes yet.
- At the end of this run, each key agent should add one concise handoff note for the next agent.
- Final response must include publish QA evidence with:
  - Final URL
  - Slug/canonical check
  - Sitemap and RSS check
  - Status code and render confirmation.
- Final response must also include a measurement handoff with:
  - Primary keyword + search intent
  - Baseline metrics if available (impressions, clicks, CTR, avg position)
  - Next measurement checkpoint and what to change next.
- Include optional `team_notes` array in output JSON with per-agent learnings and handoffs.
- `team_notes` item format: {agent_id, note, action_hint, handoff_to}.
- Keep summary <= 160 chars.
- Keep blockers and next_steps concise plain text (no markdown, no arrays).

Title: Autonomous SEO blog sprint: L&D beginner-to-advanced guide with practical checkpoints
Priority: high
Estimated Minutes: 30
Description: Increase organic traffic by running one full serialized SEO blog cycle in L&D, gamification, data, LXD, and AI. Start with topic discovery (3 candidates, pick best), then complete keyword/SERP analysis, writing, optimization, publishing, and measurement handoff. Produce publish QA evidence including live URL, sitemap, RSS, and status checks. Persist team_notes so future runs learn from this run and avoid repeated mistakes.
